main event: A radar observation of an unidentified flying object over Sullivan Island, South Carolina on January 15, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as egg-shaped with one large light and three small lights in formation.
The object was tracked on radar for 62 seconds, moving in an erratic manner.
The weather conditions were clear with good visibility at the time of the sighting.
There was not enough information available to determine the nature of the object.
The report indicates that no further contact could be made with the reporting agency to obtain a more detailed report.
sighted object: an egg-shaped object with one large light and three small lights in formation
